conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the given acceleration-time graph to determine when the object's velocity is at its maximum.
Identify the direction of the initial motion. Since the acceleration is positive, the object starts moving in the positive direction.
Determine the direction of the velocity. Since velocity is the derivative of acceleration, the velocity is positive when the acceleration is positive.
From the graph, observe that the acceleration is initially positive, indicating that the velocity is increasing. The velocity will be at its maximum when the acceleration is zero.
From the graph, the acceleration is zero at time 2 seconds. This means the velocity is at its maximum at this time.
Verify that the velocity is indeed at its maximum by checking the direction of the velocity vector at time 2 seconds.
Conclude that the object's velocity is at its maximum at time 2 seconds.
